title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Johnson & Johnson's single-dose Covid-19 vaccine works safely, the FDA said, paving the way for the agency to authorize a third vaccine in the U.S. as early as this weekend.

Moderna said it has made the initial batch of doses of a Covid-19 vaccine designed to better protect against a new strain of the coronavirus.

---

Biden signed an order directing a broad review of supply chains for critical materials -- from semiconductors to pharmaceuticals and rare-earth minerals.

---

Two Senate committees delayed votes on Neera Tanden, Biden's choice for OMB chief, whose nomination appears to be in peril.

---

William J. Burns, the president's pick to lead the CIA, told a Senate panel that he would intensify the agency's focus on China.

---

Biden announced three nominees to the Postal Service's board, a move that came as a House panel heard testimony from DeJoy.

---

The president revoked most immigration restrictions that Trump imposed last year in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

---

A federal judge rejected a telecom-industry challenge to California's net-neutrality law, clearing the way for the state to begin enforcing the consumer protections.

---

A German court secured the world's first conviction of a former Syrian official in relation to state-sanctioned torture.
